p: Whether patients with these rare disorders are more susceptible to COVID-19 and its complications, or whether COVID-19 could precipitate tumor-related complications (infarct or necrosis) in these patients is unknown. Patients with glucagonoma may be at increased risk of severe COVID-19 because of hyperglycemia and a thrombophilic state [ 110]. Patients on immunosuppressive therapies will also be vulnerable to COVID-19. Implications for management of these patients during the COVID-19 pandemic are reviewed elsewhere [ 111].
